line_text: Of dainty and such picking grievances:

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That may repeat and history his loss
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To new remembrance; for full well he knows

line_text: He cannot so precisely weed this land

line_text: As his misdoubts present occasion:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That, plucking to unfix an enemy,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: He doth unfasten so and shake a friend:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: So that this land, like an offensive wife
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: As he is striking, holds his infant up

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The very instruments of chastisement:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: So that his power, like to a fangless lion,

line_text: May offer, but not hold.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: 'Tis very true:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And therefore be assured, my good lord marshal,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: If we do now make our atonement well,

line_text: Grow stronger for the breaking.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Be it so.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Here is return'd my Lord of Westmoreland.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The prince is here at hand: pleaseth your lordship
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To meet his grace just distance 'tween our armies.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Before, and greet his grace: my lord, we come.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: When that your flock, assembled by the bell,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Encircled you to hear with reverence
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Your exposition on the holy text
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Than now to see you here an iron man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Cheering a rout of rebels with your drum,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Turning the word to sword and life to death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: That man that sits within a monarch's heart,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And ripens in the sunshine of his favour,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Would he abuse the countenance of the king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Alack, what mischiefs might he set abrooch
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: In shadow of such greatness! With you, lord bishop,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: It is even so. Who hath not heard it spoken
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: How deep you were within the books of God?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To us the speaker in his parliament;

scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To us the imagined voice of God himself;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The very opener and intelligencer
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And our dull workings. O, who shall believe
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But you misuse the reverence of your place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Employ the countenance and grace of heaven,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: As a false favourite doth his prince's name,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: In deeds dishonourable? You have ta'en up,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Under the counterfeited zeal of God,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The subjects of his substitute, my father,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And both against the peace of heaven and him
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Have here up-swarm'd them.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Good my Lord of Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I am not here against your father's peace;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But, as I told my lord of Westmoreland,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The time misorder'd doth, in common sense,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Crowd us and crush us to this monstrous form,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To hold our safety up. I sent your grace
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The parcels and particulars of our grief,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The which hath been with scorn shoved from the court,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Whereon this Hydra son of war is born;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Whose dangerous eyes may well be charm'd asleep
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: With grant of our most just and right desires,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And true obedience, of this madness cured,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Stoop tamely to the foot of majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: If not, we ready are to try our fortunes
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To the last man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And though we here fall down,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: We have supplies to second our attempt:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: If they miscarry, theirs shall second them;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And so success of mischief shall be born
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And heir from heir shall hold this quarrel up
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Whiles England shall have generation.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: You are too shallow, Hastings, much too shallow,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To sound the bottom of the after-times.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Pleaseth your grace to answer them directly
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: How far forth you do like their articles.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I like them all, and do allow them well,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And swear here, by the honour of my blood,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: My father's purposes have been mistook,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And some about him have too lavishly
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Wrested his meaning and authority.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: My lord, these griefs shall be with speed redress'd;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Upon my soul, they shall. If this may please you,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Discharge your powers unto their several counties,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: As we will ours: and here between the armies
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Let's drink together friendly and embrace,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: That all their eyes may bear those tokens home
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Of our restored love and amity.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I take your princely word for these redresses.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I give it you, and will maintain my word:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And thereupon I drink unto your grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Go, captain, and deliver to the army
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: This news of peace: let them have pay, and part:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I know it will well please them. Hie thee, captain.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To you, my noble Lord of Westmoreland.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I pledge your grace; and, if you knew what pains
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I have bestow'd to breed this present peace,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: You would drink freely: but my love to ye
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Shall show itself more openly hereafter.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I do not doubt you.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I am glad of it.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Health to my lord and gentle cousin, Mowbray.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: You wish me health in very happy season;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: For I am, on the sudden, something ill.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Against ill chances men are ever merry;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But heaviness foreruns the good event.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Therefore be merry, coz; since sudden sorrow
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Serves to say thus, 'some good thing comes
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: to-morrow.'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Believe me, I am passing light in spirit.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: So much the worse, if your own rule be true.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The word of peace is render'd: hark, how they shout!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: This had been cheerful after victory.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: A peace is of the nature of a conquest;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: For then both parties nobly are subdued,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And neither party loser.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Go, my lord,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And let our army be discharged too.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And, good my lord, so please you, let our trains
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: March, by us, that we may peruse the men
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: We should have coped withal.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Go, good Lord Hastings,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And, ere they be dismissed, let them march by.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I trust, lords, we shall lie to-night together.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Now, cousin, wherefore stands our army still?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The leaders, having charge from you to stand,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Will not go off until they hear you speak.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: They know their duties.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: My lord, our army is dispersed already;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Like youthful steers unyoked, they take their courses
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: East, west, north, south; or, like a school broke up,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Each hurries toward his home and sporting-place.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Good tidings, my Lord Hastings; for the which
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I do arrest thee, traitor, of high treason:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And you, lord archbishop, and you, Lord Mowbray,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Of capitol treason I attach you both.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Is this proceeding just and honourable?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Is your assembly so?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Will you thus break your faith?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I pawn'd thee none:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I promised you redress of these same grievances
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Whereof you did complain; which, by mine honour,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I will perform with a most Christian care.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But for you, rebels, look to taste the due
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Meet for rebellion and such acts as yours.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Most shallowly did you these arms commence,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Fondly brought here and foolishly sent hence.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Strike up our drums, pursue the scatter'd stray:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: God, and not we, hath safely fought to-day.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Some guard these traitors to the block of death,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Treason's true bed and yielder up of breath.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What's your name, sir? of what condition are you,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: and of what place, I pray?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I am a knight, sir, and my name is Colevile of the dale.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And never shall you see that I will beg
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: A ragged and forestall'd remission.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: If truth and upright innocency fail me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: I'll to the king my master that is dead,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And tell him who hath sent me after him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Here comes the prince.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Good morrow; and God save your majesty!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: This new and gorgeous garment, majesty,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Sits not so easy on me as you think.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Brothers, you mix your sadness with some fear:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: This is the English, not the Turkish court;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Not Amurath an Amurath succeeds,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: But Harry Harry. Yet be sad, good brothers,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: For, by my faith, it very well becomes you:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Sorrow so royally in you appears
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That I will deeply put the fashion on
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And wear it in my heart: why then, be sad;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: But entertain no more of it, good brothers,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Than a joint burden laid upon us all.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: For me, by heaven, I bid you be assured,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: I'll be your father and your brother too;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Let me but bear your love, I 'll bear your cares:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Yet weep that Harry's dead; and so will I;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: But Harry lives, that shall convert those tears
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: By number into hours of happiness.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: We hope no other from your majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: You all look strangely on me: and you most;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: You are, I think, assured I love you not.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: I am assured, if I be measured rightly,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Your majesty hath no just cause to hate me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: No!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: How might a prince of my great hopes forget
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: So great indignities you laid upon me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: What! rate, rebuke, and roughly send to prison
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The immediate heir of England! Was this easy?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: May this be wash'd in Lethe, and forgotten?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: I then did use the person of your father;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The image of his power lay then in me:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And, in the administration of his law,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Whiles I was busy for the commonwealth,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Your highness pleased to forget my place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The majesty and power of law and justice,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The image of the king whom I presented,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And struck me in my very seat of judgment;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Whereon, as an offender to your father,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: I gave bold way to my authority
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And did commit you. If the deed were ill,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Be you contented, wearing now the garland,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To have a son set your decrees at nought,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To pluck down justice from your awful bench,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To trip the course of law and blunt the sword
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That guards the peace and safety of your person;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Nay, more, to spurn at your most royal image
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And mock your workings in a second body.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Question your royal thoughts, make the case yours;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Be now the father and propose a son,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Hear your own dignity so much profaned,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: See your most dreadful laws so loosely slighted,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Behold yourself so by a son disdain'd;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And then imagine me taking your part
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And in your power soft silencing your son:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: After this cold considerance, sentence me;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And, as you are a king, speak in your state
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: What I have done that misbecame my place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: My person, or my liege's sovereignty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: You are right, justice, and you weigh this well;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Therefore still bear the balance and the sword:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And I do wish your honours may increase,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Till you do live to see a son of mine
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Offend you and obey you, as I did.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: So shall I live to speak my father's words:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: 'Happy am I, that have a man so bold,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That dares do justice on my proper son;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And not less happy, having such a son,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: That would deliver up his greatness so
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Into the hands of justice.' You did commit me:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: For which, I do commit into your hand
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The unstained sword that you have used to bear;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: With this remembrance, that you use the same
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: With the like bold, just and impartial spirit
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: As you have done 'gainst me. There is my hand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: You shall be as a father to my youth:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: My voice shall sound as you do prompt mine ear,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And I will stoop and humble my intents
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To your well-practised wise directions.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And, princes all, believe me, I beseech you;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: My father is gone wild into his grave,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: For in his tomb lie my affections;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And with his spirit sadly I survive,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To mock the expectation of the world,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: To frustrate prophecies and to raze out
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Rotten opinion, who hath writ me down
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: After my seeming. The tide of blood in me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Hath proudly flow'd in vanity till now:

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And flow henceforth in formal majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Fourth
